title: Substitue for Gotham.
content:
I’ve been looking a typeface lately for a prodject, and was wondering if anyone knew of a suitable subsitute for HFJ’s Gotham. I realy like the forms, but I’m not interested in purchasing the entire family, maybe just 2 or 3 weights. Does anyone know of a typeface that would give the same mood thats available à la carte?

Thanks in advance!

 [‹ San-serif font for magazine redesign](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233048/http:/typophile.com/node/19420 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font ID and organic/handcrafted font recommendations ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233048/http:/typophile.com/node/18873 "Go to next forum topic")
author: alexhb

comments.content: Excellent suggestion. For a more european flavor: [FF Super Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233048/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=super%20grotesk) or [Drescher Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233048/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=drescher).

Also consider STALEMATE. Check it out in detail here...
